title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Confiture en Pot [Potted Jam], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Confiture en Pot [Potted Jam], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brush and brown ink, graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper center:  Confiture en Pot [Potted Jam]; in graphite, lower left:  coudeuse [elbowing in]; verso: in pen and brown/black ink [up side down]:  Monsieur/Develly, peintre/à la manufacture royale de porcelaine/à Sèvres. [à Sèvres. underlined] [Mr./ Develly, painter/at the royal manufactury of porcelaine/at Sèvres.]
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Sketch showing a woman, center middleground, serving [?] jam to a child.  A figure is seated, left middleground, in front of a palm [?] tree.  A secondary sketch in left foreground shows four figures, one of whom is handing some jam [?] to a young  child.  The inscription "coudeuse" refers to some other boys at right attempting to get some jam.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Confiture en Pot [Potted Jam], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20. Pen and brush and brown ink, graphite on cream laid paper. 1989-13-21.
